title: Alright, people; what do you think should be the new 120 AP item?
body:
With DFG gone and 5.4 on its way, we're gonna need something new to complete the 120 AP trifecta. Which item (old or new) do you think should take up the mantle? If new, what should it have for passives/actives?

Personally, I think WotA could use some love. With the buff to Gunblade, there's little reason to rush its spell vamp counterpart aside from the 10% CDR. More AP should make it a tad more compatible for champs with shorter cooldowns that need the sustain (oh, hi Morde.) 

Alternatively, Rylai's is only 20 AP off.

Lets do some math, shall we?

Lets say that you are a level 15 {{champion:103}} , and before you buy this item, you are at a healthy (but not flatout OP) 480 ish AP and . You come across an {{champion:12}} , an admittedly tanky champ, at half health (lets peg it at around 1600 health, with 100 mr) 

Lets assume that you have all 25 stacks (assuming were capping it at 25 stacks, that is). One orb of deception will do 140+170 magic damage and the same in true damage on the way back. With this item, it will do roughly 140+210=350 base magic and true damage. Factor in the item passive and you get bonus damage of 350*.25= 87.5; Taking into account the other champion's missing health, it will do an additional 40% damage: 350*.4= 140. Total bonus damage from the item = roughly 227.5 going both in and out.

Total damage: 577.5 damage both ways (keep in mind that the items provides bonus damage to just one ability when it hits a champ, so it sort of fulfills the role of the old DFG but adds a component of working for that burst rather than having in on demand- we can also have like a little glowy thing around a champ who has more than a certain amount of stacks so that you can anticipate them doing a shitton of damage.

TL,DR version: Increases an ahri's q against a champ at half hp by about 65% after hitting some minions with spells.
